author: Nathaniel Taplin
title: Rio Tinto Should Keep Part of Its Record Haul
text:
Global stocks may have fallen down a hole this week, but miner Rio Tinto is providing some light.
The Australian iron-ore giant kicked off the sector’s earnings season Wednesday with its highest full-year earnings since 2010, the height of the commodities bubble. Its cash generated from operations was up 64% to $13.9 billion, and the firm is dishing out $7.2 billion of that in dividends and share buybacks. Proceeds from Rio’s coal asset sales are funding an additional $2.5 billion share repurchase.
